<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns true if copilots actions are enabled. 

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''isCopilotEnabled''' vehicle

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] (![[isCopilotEnabled]] myHeli) [[then]] {
    myHeli [[enableCopilot]] [[true]];
};
</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[enableCopilot]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->

<dt class="note">[[User:Strangepete|Strangepete]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Only returns whether or not the actions are enabled and shown to the pilot and co-pilot. This will still return TRUE if the pilot uses the 'Lock Controls' action to disable co-pilot controls.<br>
You can use the [[Arma 3: Event Handlers#ControlsShifted|Arma 3 Event Handler - Controls Shifted]] to detect 'Take Controls' or 'Release Controls' actions 

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
